page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY; OLD THRYBERGH
page.content: Although{Thrybergh}has grown quite large in recent years a lot of the{old {village}can still be seen. The village used to belong to the{Fullerton } family. Their family house is now part of the{Golf Club.}The old village school is now a house. Some of the farm buildings remain, though they are not all farms now. There are{two } {ancient crosses, one}on{The Green}and {one}in the{churchyard. St. Leonard's {church}was{built}in the{1100's,}but it was enlarged in more recent times. The oldest{memorials}in the church are about{700 years old.}Several of the memorials are of members of the {Reresby}and{Fullerton families.}There is some{old stained glass.}Outside the church is a{mound of earth}where the {Reresbys}are{buried}and the{rectory } dating from{Georgian times. }
